text: [Music]
underwater rugby involves two teams
seeking to gain control of a slightly
negatively buoyant ball and passing it
into a heavy metal bucket at the bottom
of the swimming pool it originated in
German diving clubs during the early
1960s but in all honesty has very little
in common with rugby football except of
course for the name
it was my first time ever to swim with a
snorkel and flippers and I was
struggling to keep up so I decided to
get one of the players to the shallow
end of the pool to tell me more well you
keep it protected keep the ball
protected it's a contact sport so you'll
be tackling each other but you won't
tackle above the neck same as in rugby
and you won't interfere with the other
guys flippers because that just ruins
the game yeah fantastic stuff Rob thank
you very much for teaching me underwater
rugby I'm glad you came along and
enjoyed it i am peter of watcher
underwater rugby player BBC news
[Applause]
